      • getTables

        public java.util.List<Table> getTables()
        Returns a list-object of all Table objecten in this cafe when you are not logged in, you get a empty list in return.
        Returns:
        a list of all tables

      • setActiveTable

        public void setActiveTable(Table t)
        Makes a specific Table active in the cafe when you are not logged in, a dummy table is set.
        Parameters:
        t - the Table-object that will become the active table

      • getActiveTable

        public Table getActiveTable()
        Return the active table or a Dummytable if you are not logged in
        Returns:
        a Table-object that is the active table

      • calculateUnpayedOrders

        public double calculateUnpayedOrders()
        Return a value of all unpayed orders of all tables if you are not logged in -10000 is givin
        Returns:
        the sum of all unpayed orders.

      • getUnpayedOrders

        public OrderSet getUnpayedOrders(Ober ober)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an OrdersSet object with all unpayed orders a the specific ober

      • getUnpayedOrders

        public OrderSet getUnpayedOrders()
        Return all unpayed orders of all tables, Obers if you are not logged in an empty set is givin
        Returns:
        an OrdersSet object with all unpayed orders

      • getPayedOrders

        public OrderSet getPayedOrders()
        Return all payed orders of all Obers. These are the orders that still are in the possesion of the obers. So the orders that are not givin to the cashdesk if you are not logged in an empty set is givin
        Returns:
        an OrdersSet object with all payed orders of the obers

      • calculatePayedOrders

        public double calculatePayedOrders()
        Return the sum of all payed orders of all tables These are the orders that still are in the possesion of the obers. So the orders that are not givin to the cashdesk if you are not logged in -10000 is givin
        Returns:
        the sum of all payed orders in the possession of the obers.

      • createPDF

        public java.lang.String createPDF(java.util.Collection<Order> orders,
                                  boolean openAfterCreation)
                           throws InternalException
        Parameters:
        orders - the collection of orders you want to have in your PDF
        openAfterCreation - true if you want to open the createdPDF
        Returns:
        A string that is the path of the file
        Throws:
        InternalException - if an internal error occurred (File is open, document not found,...)

      • SendMail

        public boolean SendMail(java.lang.String attachment)
        Sends a standard mail to the standard mail adress from a standard mail adress
        Parameters:
        attachment - a string that represents the path of the attachment
        Returns:
        true if the mail is succesfully send. false if it was not possible to send the mail. (ober not logged in, error sending mail)

      • topObers

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<Ober,java.lang.Double> topObers()
                                                        throws InternalException
        Return a linkedHashmap the all obers order by highest income the keys are the representing Obers the values are the representing sums of the orders in the cashdesk
        Returns:
        the three best obers
        Throws:
        InternalException - if an internal error occurred (DB errors,...)

      • getIncome

        public OrderSet getIncome(Ober ober)
                   throws InternalException
        Return all payed orders of a specific ober. These are the orders that are NOT in the possesion of the obers. So the orders that are givin to the cashdesk if you are not logged in an empty set is givin
        Parameters:
        ober - the ober-object where we want all the payed orders from
        Returns:
        an OrderSet-object with all the payed orders in the cashdek of an ober
        Throws:
        InternalException - if an internal error occurred (DB errors,...)

      • getIncome

        public OrderSet getIncome(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
                   throws InternalException
        Return all payed orders of a specific date. These are the orders that are NOT in the possesion of the obers. So the orders that are givin to the cashdesk if you are not logged in an empty set is givin
        Parameters:
        localDate - the specific date we want the ordersset
        Returns:
        an OrderSet-object with all the payed orders in the cashdek of the specific date
        Throws:
        InternalException - if an internal error occurred (DB errors,...)

      • topDrieObers

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<Ober,java.lang.Double> topDrieObers()
                                                            throws InternalException
        Return a linkedHashmap the three best obers order by highest income the keys are the representing Obers the values are the representing sums of the orders in the cashdesk
        Returns:
        the three best obers
        Throws:
        InternalException - if an internal error occurred (DB errors,...)

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String lastName,
                     java.lang.String firstName,
                     java.lang.String password)
              throws InternalException
        Login system in the Cafe Applicatie
        Parameters:
        lastName - the last name
        firstName - the first name
        password - the password
        Returns:
        true if you're logged in, false if you are not logged in.
        Throws:
        InternalException - if an internal error occurred (DB errors,...)

      • logOut

        public void logOut()
        Logging out of the cafe the active table and the active ober are set to dummy objects.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws InternalException
        closes the cafe. exports the payed orders to the DB (= the cashdesk) serialise the unpayed order
        Throws:
        InternalException - occures when the serialisetion or the export to the DB isn't fullfilled

        public java.util.Set<Liquid> getLiquids()
        Return all the liquids in the cafe
        Returns:
        a set of liquid objects
